intro: Lapeirousia bainesii var. breviflora, commonly known as the Breve-flowered Gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing vibrant flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
